Morning HubSpotters:
quick question: is Helvetica  safe to use in email templates?
if so, what is the best way to implement it in the email? I attach it to the body tag in the css but doesnt render through
Many thanks :pray:

Hi Thierry-Luc, Helvetica is absolutely safe to use but only in that it will render on Apple computers (unless you happen to have it on a PC).

Best way is to define `font-family: Helvetica, Arial, san-serif` on h1, h2, h3, p, li etc embedded in your head styles.

```/* TYPOGRAPHY */```
    
```h1, h1 a, h2, h2 a, h3, h3 a, h4, h4 a, h5, h5 a, h6, h6 a, p, ul, li { font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; text-decoration: none; font-weight: normal; margin: 0; padding: 0; mso-effects-shadow-color: #ffffff; }```
BTW, `mso-effects-shadow` will render text the colour you want in dark mode in Outlook for PC. Useful if you use a dark background image and Outlook decides the text should be dark too!
Hey all - I realized that HubSpot doesn’t accept lists or JSON context variables for API-triggered emails. Any advice on how to navigate that limitation?
Generally the workaround is to send it pre-formated HTML into the personalization tokens that you would normally use the templating language to define
